title: Government Records Access and Management Amendments
description: Government Records Access and Management Amendments

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
House/ received bill from Legislative Research in Clerk of the House
House/ 1st reading (Introduced) in House Rules Committee

general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Government Records Access and Management Act.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that the government records ombudsman shall provide resources and services related to a fee dispute in relation to a records request;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions regulating costs chargeable by a governmental entity for employee time in processing a records request under the Government Records Access and Management Act;<hr><ltbullet>adds provisions to regulate the disclosure of records and fee information regarding work-related contact information for an employee of a local education agency;<hr><ltbullet>requires a governmental entity to provide an itemized estimate of costs and fees expected to be incurred before the governmental entity begins to process a request or requires payment or deposit when fees are expected to exceed a certain amount;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions of the Government Records Access and Management Act to make an appeal to a chief administrative officer an optional process for appealing an estimate of fees that exceeds a certain amount;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a State Records Committee review of an agency access denial, fee waiver denial, or fee estimate dispute is de novo;<hr><ltbullet>requires a political subdivision to permit an optional appeal of an estimate of fees that exceeds a certain amount directly to the State Records Committee;<hr><ltbullet>modifies existing procedures; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming changes and style corrections.

action_history.description: House/ received bill from Legislative Research
